meanings.definition: To last longer than something else.
meanings.sent1: The old tree outlasts the new sapling in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The battery in my toy car outlasts the one in my remote control.
meanings.sent3: The tortoise outlasts the hare in the race, proving slow and steady wins the race.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed outlasts any obstacle in her path.
meanings.sent5: The ancient ruins outlasts the passing of time, standing as a testament to history.

meanings.definition: To continue to exist or be successful for a longer time than something else.
meanings.sent1: The small business outlasts the big chain store in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: His legacy outlasts his lifetime, remembered by generations to come.
meanings.sent3: The little plant outlasts the harsh winter, blooming beautifully in spring.
meanings.sent4: Her love for him outlasts any hardship they face, growing stronger each day.
meanings.sent5: The classic song outlasts the trends, remaining popular through the years.
